summary: Employment-related identity fraud occurs when people use a name or Social Security number (SSN) other than their own to get a job. This fraud makes it harder for IRS to collect taxes and harder for the Social Security Administration to manage benefits. Though the true scope of this fraud is unknown, we identified 1.3 million SSNs from 2016 that were associated with both signs of...
title: Employment-Related Identity Fraud: Improved Collaboration and Other Actions Would Help IRS and SSA Address Risks
